 The next point at which we need to ask for the results from the inner, and then store them.
long PathsDone
 Number of points evaluated so far (also stored in the 'Inner').
long Increment
 The power at which we want to store results (eg at 2,4,8,16 ... or 10,100,1000 ...).

Detailed Description

An implementation of a statistics gatherer, that keeps track of the results given in powers of (Increment) It provides the final mean, standard deviation, and also the mean and sd at any power of (Increment) below the final result

Definition at line 15 of file convergencetable.h.

void StatGathering::ConvergenceTable::AddOneResult ( double  result  )  [virtual]

Add one result. Passes along that result to the inner, if we have hit 'StoppingPoint' then ask for the mean and sd from inner, and store in our array

Implements StatGathering::StatisticsMC.

00043 {
00044   // Get the work done by the 'Inner' statistics gatherer
00045   Inner->AddOneResult( result );
00046   ++PathsDone;
00047 
00048   // If we have hit a power of Increment, we ask the 'Inner' for the results so far,
00049   // and add it to our array (along with the number of points that contributed to that result)
00050   if (PathsDone == StoppingPoint)
00051   {
00052     StoppingPoint *= Increment;
00053     GetResultsFromInner( ResultsSoFar );
00054   }
00055 }

std::vector< std::vector< double > > StatGathering::ConvergenceTable::GetResultsSoFar (  )  const [virtual]

Get a 2D vector of all our results so far

Returns:
2D vector, formatted as for Inner, for all the powers of increment passed, and one for where we are now, in ascending order of number

Implements StatGathering::StatisticsMC.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

std::ostream& operator<< ( std::ostream &  out,
const ConvergenceTable &  conTab 
) [friend]

friend to << so that we can overload the << operator to output a ConvergenceTable object

Outputs the table to the stream in the format: "Mean SD Number" for each of the powers of Increment passed so far, in reverse order (ie the final answer comes first, works down to smaller numbers)

Definition at line 121 of file convergencetable.cpp.

00127   // One entry of this will duplicate the current state of the inner.
00128   // First, a separator

00130

Member Data Documentation

Wrapper<StatisticsMC> StatGathering::ConvergenceTable::Inner [private]

The 'Inner' does the calculating from point to point, then passes up the information to the convergence table when asked - in the function GetResultsFromInner

Definition at line 51 of file convergencetable.h.

Referenced by AddOneResult(), AddOneSetOfResults(), GetResultsFromInner(), StatGathering::operator<<(), StatGathering::operator>>(), Reset(), and SetResultsSoFar().

std::vector<std::vector<double> > StatGathering::ConvergenceTable::ResultsSoFar [private]

Our 2D vector of results so far for each power of increment that we have passed, where number is the number of points that contributed (ie increment^n). The specific format of this vector depends on the type of StatisticsMC used.

Definition at line 56 of file convergencetable.h.

Referenced by AddOneResult(), AddOneSetOfResults(), GetResultsSoFar(), StatGathering::operator>>(), Reset(), and SetResultsSoFar().
